values.headline: PM/ITA at Cisco Systems

values.summary:
Architecture Services US
Architect Services are required for resources to scale, there has been an increase demand for Architecture Self Service for project teams.  The primary goal of this service is to:
•Provide the ability for project teams to initiated engagement with the Architecture Process in more efficiently.
•Provide an initial Assessment of a projects ability to meet a standard set of Architecture requirements.
•Automate the creation of Architecture feedback based on the results of a Self Assessment.
•Provide the ability for Architects to enter their Architecture requirements/standards.

Application: Single Trading Company (STC)
The Single Trading Company (STC) initiative is Cisco's response to business demand for direct selling capabilities (product, service, software) in more countries.  The initiative is focused on constructing a commerce back-end (new legal entities and buy-sell model) to support the next decade of global growth


Application: Online Contract Management(OCM)
OCM provides a process that enables partners and customers to easily make updates to Service Agreements with minimal support by enhancing and simplifying current contract management capabilities, improving Service Agreement Data Quality, and introducing new functionality.

Currently working with AurionPro Solutions as Sr. Software Consultant and serving various clients in San Francisco Bay Area focused mainly on electronic payment domain using almost all cutting edge Java / Enterprise technologies like Spring, JMS, Webservices, etc... I started my career as software engineer with Baeurer Infotech Ltd. Almost spent 2.5 years of my career on Panther Prolifics technologies, which are now in coffin. But I got  very good experience on enterprise functionalities like Procure To Payment cycles, Financial Accounting, Inventories, and yes ... how to save organization's money.

Then I joined Trigyn Technologies on basis of Panther and worked there for 4 years and successfully shifted my career path on Java/J2EE technologies. I worked mostly for United Nations and its various devisions like UNDP, UNOV, CTBTO, etc... Working for 4 years for same client gave me good understanding of UN's business process and due to excellent people at Trigyn I learnt a lot and could enhance my skills.

values.headline: Mobile Architect at GoDaddy
values.summary:
Boy, how does one summarize 21+ years behind the keyboard. Well, I could go with the usual "seasoned this" and "accomplished that", but instead let me cut to the chase: despite various titles that I've had throughout the years, I'm a coder, I spend most of my waking hours writing code, reading code, reading about code. I've done significant work in most of the important languages of our times. 

A few years ago I turned my career around going from developing mega-data storage systems to mobile. Most would consider that a crazy move, I pretty much had to start over from square one. But here I am today, successful in mobile, enjoying every minute of it, and continuing to get paid for having fun. 

If you're looking for keywords here are some: Objective-C, the whole iOS eco-system, Unix (since '84), Python, to name the main ones, but recently I am very interested in what I believe is possibly the lingua franca of the future : Javascript (jQuery Mobile, Sencha, Cappucino) and of course, node.js. 

I thrive on influencing people (without controlling them), learning from my peers and teaching them what I know in exchange. 

I thrive on shipping good quality mobile product in cadence. 

I like working with UI/Ux designers and going through as many iterations as it takes to get every single pixel in its place. 

I tend to choose simple solutions before over-engineered ones, Return on Investment before technological coolness.
